physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Bilateral severe thigh pain, lower limb weakness, and difficulty ambulating.

Bilateral thigh pain intensified, requiring two crutches and narcotics for pain. X-rays of both femurs revealed cortical thickening in the midshafts. MRI confirmed bilateral stress fractures with edema.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Thigh pain increased and ambulation became more difficult.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Commenced teriparatide treatment (20 Âµg daily). Thigh pain and weakness more prominent.
Repeat MRI showed decreased edema at the fracture sites with faint cortical bridging. Thigh pain lessened.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement noted in thigh pain and weakness.
Complete healing of both atypical fractures was noted on repeat MRI in June 2010.
